q: Posted at 6:00 AM ET, 01/25/2011 When the Cold War ended 20 years ago, when I was Chairman[ of the Joint Chiefs] and Mr.[ Richard] Cheney was Secretary of Defense, we cut the defense budget by 25 percent, and we reduced the force by 500,000 active duty soldiers. -- Retired Colin Powell , January 23, 2011 At a time when the United States is facing a fiscal crisis and a mountain of debt, the former Secretary of State offered this history lesson on CNN

He described the scene, saying, People came from all around, surrounding us, punching us, kicking us, trying to rip the clothes off my female producer. It was weird. And we were lucky, frankly.... I would start to slap back and then realize this is going to make it worse. My adrenline was pumping so much. I've never really been in a fight like this or attacked by a mob like this. A. VIGUERIE& RALPH BENKO| 1/27/11 3:59 AM EST The issues facing the Republican Party today look close to identical to the primary campaign between Ronald Reagan and George H.W. Bush . The National Journal recently reported, Other Republicans believe[ Mike Pence ] Mike Pence 's ideological purity is what makes him at once dangerous to his rivals in a primary and dangerous to his own party if he secures the nod in a general election. In her review, Gwen Ifill rounds up some of the finger-pointing Donald Rumsfeld employs in the book: `` Mostly, Donald Rumsfeld is certain-- never more so than when he is chronicling the deficiencies of others. His list of disdain runs long-- from former secretaries of state Condoleezza Rice and Colin Powell , to Coalition Provisional Authority chief Paul Bremer (` It remained difficult to get him to accept the idea that Iraq belonged to the Iraqis'), to former Army secretary Eric Shinseki , to former Joint Chiefs chairman Hugh Shelton , Colin Powell aide Richard Armitage, John McCain and, of course, the news media. `` The most consistent censure is reserved for Colin Powell , Condoleezza Rice and anyone who operated in their diplomatic orbit. Howard Stern to David Letterman : sorry about your sex scandal( video) Instead of deflecting Howard Stern 's apology, David Letterman responded with candor and a bit of reciprocal praise. `` You have been very, very nice to me on the radio and viciously ugly to me on the radio and I except both with equanimity because I know a little bit about how you operate and I'm still fond of your talent and your ability and what you've represented to the United States of America-and of course, the world.
